definition: Closing section that synthesizes main points, reinforces the thesis, and provides closure or implications

positive_examples: The conclusion synthesizes the three main arguments into a unified insight.
Rather than merely summarizing, the conclusion extends the implications.
The conclusion returns to the opening hook, creating circular closure.
Ending with a call to action gives the conclusion persuasive force.
training_hints.disambiguation: Functional role of synthesis and closure, not just final position
